Entries.1189: Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.1/For starters, you may want to fish in Cindersap Pond. You may find some pretty easy fish for training. Smallmouth Bass and Goldfish should be easy catches. Sometimes you may even find a rare variant of Goldfish, depending on the season. There is quite the variety year round! The mountain lake is also a great spot to fish, as it is abundant with species: Carps, Chubs, Bullheads and Largemouth Bass live in this area all year around, while others, such as the Zebra Tilapia and Arowana, can only be found there during certain seasons. And don't forget that some fish prefer rainy weather.
Entries.1190: Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.1/Summer is here, and a lot of new fish are in search for warmer waters. Tilapia and Pike may be migrating to the rivers of Pelican Town. Some have even been spotted in Cindersap Pond! And be sure not to miss out on the Dorado, Rainbow Trout, and Tucunare in the rivers as well, since they won't be back to these warm river waters until this time next year. There should be pretty interesting fish to catch at the ocean as well, such as Red Mullet, Robalo, and Red Snapper. And if you haven't caught a Ladyfish or Anchoviella yet, take the opportunity to do so because soon they will be gone! But beware of the Sea Snakes, for on rainy days, they go hunting.
Entries.1191: Angler's Guide Fall Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Fall Ed.1/Fall brings with it some rare fish such as Sea Cucumbers, Albacore, and Haddock. And while we're talking about ocean fish, some ocean fish that could be found during Spring come back to town at this time of year such as Eels, Anchovies and Sardines. Arowana should be back at the lake as well. Schools of Tench usually come to these parts during Fall and Winter. Be on the lookout for Salmon and Tiger Trout as well, and if you haven't caught a Catfish yet, you better run to the nearest river, but only on rainy days! And while you're at it, you may even find a Walleye!
Entries.1192: Angler's Guide Win. Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Win. Ed.1/Winter is probably one of the best season to fish, as you have a lot more free time to devote to the craft! Lingcod, Perch and Arctic Char can be found in the rivers, Tuna in the ocean, and for the experienced anglers out there, try your hand at catching a Sturgeon from the lakes or even a Squid in the ocean! And speaking of the ocean, don't miss your chance to catch a Haddock, Hagfish, King Crab, Sea Cucumber, and Albacore, as they won't be back again until Fall. If you're unable to catch a Hering or Halibut, don't worry, as they won't be leaving for a while.
Entries.1193: Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.2/Hope you all had a great year! Now let's talk about some hardcore angler stuff. Barracuda a voracious fish can be found at the ocean on sunny days and Eel on rainy days. If you are lucky enough you may even come accross with a Spinny Dogfish at deep waters at any weather. One reader wrote us about really rare and interesting fish in a pond in some slime infested woods, if you got a sword, might be worth checking.
Entries.1194: Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.2/Another summer is here, and there's no better time to catch the nocturnal Super Cucumber or the diurnal Pufferfish and Octopus. Just make sure to arrive early if you want to have a chance at finding the Octopus, as they usually leave after lunch. Mantarays can be found in deep ocean waters, but they are really fierce and a fairly difficult catch. An explorer has written to us about some really interesting and rare fish in the underground mines, as well. Take your sword, your pickaxe, and we're sure you will not regret it.
Entries.1195: Angler's Guide Fall Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Fall Ed.2/This Fall, be sure not to waste the oportunity to catch a Swordfish. You can find them in deep ocean waters in the afternoons. A reader from Calico desert has given us a hot tip: There's some unique fish that you may find in the desert, such as the weird Sandfish, the poisonous Scorpion Carp, the dangerous Longnose Gar and Tiger Fish, the ancient Lungfish, and the shocking Electric Catfish.
Entries.1196: Angler's Guide Win. Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Win. Ed.2/Another winter has arrived, and you are probably experienced enough by now to face our greatest challenges. Goblin Sharks are one of those, and can be found in the ocean at night. They are known for being ferocious and extremelly hard to catch. They're also really ugly. People who have managed to catch one and survive said the trouble they went through was certainly worth the gold.^ A reader of ours who just so happens to be a scientist has written to us reporting some abnormal fish seen in the sewers that you might want to check out.
Entries.1197: Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.3/Advanced pond fishing tips: Pleco and Algae Eaters are nocturnal, bottom feeding fish that usually prefer rainy days. Some types prefer cold waters though. Elephant Fish, Freshwater Butterfly, Clown Loach, and Pangasius are all common fish during hot weather. Cold weather brings Sauger and Ide to ponds and during Fall, you may find a Redtail Shark, which is not an actual shark, Pangasius, and Freshwater Butterflyfish.
Entries.1198: Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.3/Let's talk rivers. Some fish will plague most freshwater spots. This is the case with the Trahira and Pacu, as they can be found in several fishing spots and will only leave during Winter. By the way, it's summertime, and this is the season for Freshwater Pufferfish. You may also find Green Terror in the rivers, as they usually arrive in the Spring and stay for the summer.
Entries.1199: Angler's Guide Fall Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Fall Ed.3/Let's talk about Eels and octopuses, they are only around for one season, but different types prefer different weather conditions. Eels are nocturnal and most octopuses are diurnal, but the Mimic Octopus that can be caught during spring prefers the dawn.
Entries.1200: Angler's Guide Win. Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Angler's Guide Win. Ed.3/Some fish prefer wild, hostile, and inhabitted places, such as the Slimejack, Lamprey, and Piranha. Some prefer swamps, such as the Mudskipper, but be carefull in swamps because they may have Water Snakes.^ We've also received uncorroborated reports of tainted algae and fish recently. In popular beliefs, the taint is called 'void'. Until we can confirm what the substance is, please be careful when encountering suspicious looking water fauna and flora. We'd also advise you to take samples to your local science institute, so long as you follow proper safety protocols, to assist in understanding this strange phenomena.

Entries.221: Folks, I've got an announcement to make. This is the last new episode of Livin' Off The Land before my retirement. I've had a good time, and I'll miss you folks. But before going, let me tell you about the legend of the magic fish. It is said that they live in a secret pond and can be found only during winter. Oh, and I've been told the station's going to start playing reruns next year. ^^Take care!

Goblin Sharks are one of those, and can be found in the ocean at night. They are known for being ferocious and extremelly hard to catch. They're also really ugly.^ People who have managed to catch one and survive said the trouble they went through was certainly worth the gold.^ A reader of ours who just so happens to be a scientist has written to us reporting some abnormal fish seen in the sewers that you might want to check out.^ We wish you a Happy New Year and we will be back with more new editions come Spring!^^-Good Luck Fishing %item object 1196 1 %%
Entries.vincegift: Hey @,^I wanted to give Vincent a Starfish for his birthday. I asked Willy but he said you are the best person to help me. If you bring me a Starfish I will reward you!^  -Thanks,^Kent%item quest 230 %%
Entries.angler9: Dear Anglers,^^ Advanced pond fishing tips: Pleco and Algae Eaters are nocturnal, bottom feeding fish that usually prefer rainy days. Some types prefer cold waters though. Elephant Fish, Freshwater Butterfly, Clown Loach, and Pangasius are all common fish during hot weather. Cold weather brings Sauger and Ide to ponds and during Fall, you may find a Redtail Shark, which is not an actual shark, Pangasius, and Freshwater Butterflyfish.^^-Good Luck Fishing %item object 1197 1 %%
Entries.blinky: Fisherman Wanted^I need a good three eyed mutant fish specimen. I'm conducting an experiment on the levels of mutation in fish living in the sewers.^Reward: 1000g^ -Demetrius%item quest 228 %%
Entries.robalo: Hey @.^Season is almost over and I wanted to make a stock out of Robalo. They are absolutely delicious and I am running out of them. If you bring me 20 of them I will give you a very generous reward.^ -Gus%item quest 229 %%
Entries.angler10: Dear Anglers,^^ Let's talk rivers. Some fish will plague most freshwater spots. This is the case with the Trahira and Pacu, as they can be found in several fishing spots and will only leave during Winter. By the way, it's summertime, and this is the season for Freshwater Pufferfish. You may also find Green Terror in the rivers, as they usually arrive in the Spring and stay for the summer.^^-Good Luck Fishing %item object 1198 1 %%
Entries.angler11: Dear Anglers,^^ Let's talk about Eels and octopuses, they are only around for one season, but different types prefer different weather conditions. Eels are nocturnal and most octopuses are diurnal, but the Mimic Octopus that can be caught during spring prefers the dawn.^^-Good Luck Fishing %item object 1199 1 %%
Entries.angler12: Dear Anglers,^^ Some fish prefer wild, hostile, and inhabitted places, such as the Slimejack, Lamprey, and Piranha. Some prefer swamps, such as the Mudskipper, but be carefull in swamps because they may have Water Snakes.^ We've also received uncorroborated reports of tainted algae and fish recently. In popular beliefs, the taint is called 'void'. Until we can confirm what the substance is, please be careful when encountering suspicious looking water fauna and flora. We'd also advise you to take samples to your local science institute, so long as you follow proper safety protocols, to assist in understanding this strange phenomena.^^-Good Luck Fishing %item object 1200 1 %%
Entries.trapped: @,^I'm researching a dark spell that my ex wife cast on some poor soul.^Could you please bring me one of the red fish that can be found in her swamp? I believe it was a soul trapped in a fish body by some dark incantation.^ -M. Rasmodius, Wizard %item quest 232 %%

Entries.Mon8: Hey @, if you are struggling with fierce fish, try using Trap Bobber. It is really helpfull!
Entries.spring_Tue: @, have you tried fishing in the pond in the forest?$bThere are a lot of goldfish there. Good for practing, but not very challenging.
Entries.spring_Tue8: Hey @, I tried fishing in the pond and got a huge Pangasius.$hThey are very strong swimmers and their meat is delicious.
Entries.spring_Wed: $sI was fihing in town one day and all I caught was Trahiras and Pacus, then I went to the forest and all I caught was lots of Chubs.$s#$b#Not cool.
Entries.spring_Wed8: Arowanas are as fierce as they are beautiful. It's too bad that they prefer rainy weather.
Entries.spring_Mon: Oh @, have you tried fishing while it's raining? Some species like Shad, Anchoviella, and Pleco will only come out while raining.
Entries.spring_Mon8: Oh @, have you tried fishing while it's raining? Some species like Arowana, Eel, and Catfish can only be caught during the rain.
Entries.spring_Thu: Hey @, caught a Zebra Tilapia in the lake the other day.$h#$b# They are fierce, but make for good money.$eThey usually come out on sunny days.
Entries.spring_Thu8: Hey @, caught some Barracudas at the ocean the other day.$h#$b#They are really tough to catch, but can really turn a profit.$eThey usually come out on sunny days.
Entries.spring_Fri: Hello @. $s#$b#Be careful with sea snakes.$s#$b#Almost got bitten by one the other day!
Entries.summerBeach: Good morning!$h#$b#Nice day for fishing, ain't it?$h#$b#Hu ha!
Entries.summer_Mon: Ahoy @.$h#$b# It's funny, saltwater pufferfish prefer sunny days, but freshwater ones prefer the rain.
Entries.summer_Mon8: Ahoy Skipper.$h#$b#It's funny, common octopi like warmer waters, but there are some species that prefer a more mild climate.
Entries.summer_Sun: Hey.$h#$b# Ladyfish will be out out of season soon. Try cathing one while you can.
Entries.summer_Sun8: Hey.$h#$b# Robalo will be out out of season soon. Try to catch one while you still can!
Entries.summer_Fri: Hello @.$h#$b#Did you know there are several types of Carp?$h#$b#Each prefer a different season or different weather.
Entries.summer_Fri8: Hello @.$h#$b#Did you know there are several types of Eel?$h#$b#Each prefer a different season or different weather. Not all of them like rainy weather.
Entries.fall_Tue: Hello @.$h#$b#Caught a very beautiful Clown Knifefish in the lake just yesterday. What a fish!
Entries.fall_Sun: Oh @.$h#$b#Did you know that Redtail Shark is actually a type of loach, not a shark?$eThey are usually found in ponds.
Entries.winter_Sat: Ahoy @. $bThis isn't the best weather for fishing, but several fish come to these waters around this time of year.$eIf you can brave the cold, you can find some very interesting fish!
Entries.winter_Fri: Hey @.$bTry catching a Lingcod in the river. They're hard to catch, but it's nice money.
Entries.winter_Fri8: Hey @. $bHave you tried catching an Arctic Char? They're very hard to catch and worth quite a lot, but even if they weren't, they're simply beautiful!
Entries.winter_Tue: Hello @. How are ya?$b Why do people call the Icedevil a vegetarian fish? I have no idea.
Entries.winter_Thu: Ahoy.$bPike, Perch, Tench, Walleye, Sauger, and Ide make for some very diverse fishing in the pond this time of year.
Entries.winter_Wed: Hey @.$bI would definitely raise Sturgeons in a fish tank. They're very lucrative fish.$bThough it's been a while since I last went fishing in the mountains. I should get out there soon
Entries.winter_Sun: Hey.$h#$b#Haddock will be out out of season soon. If you haven't caught one yet this Winter, you probably should.

Entries.Willy: If I wasn't putting myself at risk of getting a cold, I would definitely stay out all day fishing.$h#$b# Some fish are only happy when it rains.

Entries.1189: Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Prim. Ed.1/Fara empezar, es posible que desee pescar en el Bosque Tizn. Puede encontrar algunos peces bastante fciles de entrenar. Debe de ser fcil pescar Lubinas y Peces dorados, a veces podras encontrar una variante muy rara de Pez dorado. El lago de la montaa es un gran lugar para pescar, ya que alberga una gran cantidad de especies diferentes. Se sabe de: Carpas, Barbos, Siluros y Percas, viven en esta rea durante todo el ao. Algunos otros, como Tilapias Cebra y Arowanas, solo se quedarn all durante algunas temporadas. Recuerde que algunos peces prefieren el clima lluvioso.
Entries.1190: Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Ver. Ed.1/El verano est aqu y muchos peces nuevos buscaran aguas clidas, Tilapias y Lucios pueden estar migrando a los ros de Pueblo Pelcano, algunos incluso han sido vistos en el Bosque Tizn. Aprovecha y pesca en los ros alguno Peces dorados,Truchas arcoris y Tucunares , ya que solo migran a aguas clidas en esta poca del ao. Tambin debera haber cosas bastante interesantes en el ocano, como Salmonetes, Robalos y Pargos rojos, si an no ha atrapado un Elopidae o Anchoviellas, aproveche la oportunidad porque pronto se irn, pero tenga cuidado con las serpientes marinas, en Los das lluviosos salen a cazar.
Entries.1191: Angler's Guide Fall Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Oto. Ed.1/El otoo trae algunos peces raros como Pepinos de mar, Atn blanco y Eglefinos. Algunos peces ocenicos de primavera regresan a la ciudad en otoo, como las Anguilas, Anchoas y la Sardinas. Los arowanas tambin deberan de estar de regreso en el lago. Generalmente vienen para escapar del verano durante otoo e invierno. Cuidado con los Salmnes y Truchas tigre, si no ha capturado un Pez Gato, mejor correr al ro ms cercano, pero slo en das de lluvia e incluso  podras pescar Lucios.
Entries.1192: Angler's Guide Win. Ed.1/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Inv. Ed.1/El invierno es probablemente una de las mejores estaciones para pescar en los ros, Bacalao largo, Cachuelos y Truchas alpinas e incluso Atn en el ocano. Para los ms experimentados hay Esturines en los lagos o incluso Calamares en el ocano. No pierda la oportunidad de pescar EglefinoS, Peces bruja, Cangrejos reales, Pepinos de mar y Atnes blancos, ya que solo se ven en otoo, pero si echa de menos los Arenques o Fletnes no hay problema, ya que no se irn por un tiempo.
Entries.1193: Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Prim. Ed.2/Espero que todos hayan tenido un gran ao! Ahora hablemos de algunas cosas de pescadores profesionales. Barracuda un pez voraz se puede encontrar en el ocano en das soleados y Anguilas en das lluviosos. Si tienes la suerte, incluso puedes encontrarte con un Mielgas en aguas profundas en cualquier clima. Un lector nos escribi sobre peces realmente raros e interesantes en un estanque en algunos bosques infestados de limo, si tienes una espada, podra valer la pena revisarlo.
Entries.1194: Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Ver. Ed.2/Lleg otro verano, y no hay mejor momento para atrapar el Sper Pepino nocturno o diurnos Peces Globo y Pulpos. Solo asegrese de llegar temprano si quieres tener la oportunidad de encontrar un Pulpo, ya que generalmente salen despus del almuerzo. Las Mantarrayas se pueden encontrar en aguas profundas del ocano, pero son realmente feroces y difcil de capturar. Un explorador tambin nos ha escrito sobre algunos peces realmente interesantes y raros en las minas subterrneas. Toma tu espada, tu pico, y estamos seguros de que no te arrepentirs.
Entries.1195: Angler's Guide Fall Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Oto. Ed.2/Este otoo, no pierda la oportunidad de atrapar un pez espada. Se encuentran por las tardes en aguas profundas en el ocano . Un lector del Desierto de Calico nos ha dado un consejo: hay algunos peces nicos que puedes encontrar en el desierto, como el extrao Lenguado, la venenosa Carpa escorpin, el peligroso Gar de pico largo, incluso Peses Tigre, el antiguo Peses pulmonados y el impactante Bagre Elctrico.
Entries.1196: Angler's Guide Win. Ed.2/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Inv. Ed.2/Ha llegado otro invierno, y probablemente ya tenga la experiencia suficiente para enfrentar nuestros mayores desafos. Los tiburones duendes son uno de esos, y se pueden encontrar en el ocano por la noche. Son conocidos por ser feroces y extremadamente difciles de atrapar. Tambin son realmente feos. Aquellos que lograron sobrevivir al atrapar un dijeron que el problema por el que pasaron vali la pena.^ Un lector nuestro que resulta ser un cientfico nos ha escrito informando sobre algunos peces anormales que se pueden ver en las alcantarillas y que tal vez desees revisar.
Entries.1197: Angler's Guide Spr. Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Prim. Ed.3/Consejos avanzados para la pesca en estanques: los Plecos y los comedores de algas son peces nocturnos que se alimentan en el fondo y generalmente prefieren das lluviosos. Sin embargo, algunos tipos prefieren aguas fras. El Pez elefante, Pez mariposa de agua dulce, Locha payaso y el Pangasio son peces comunes durante un clima clido. El clima fro atrae a los estanques Saugers e Ides y durante el otoo, puedes encontrar Tiburones de cola roja -los cuales no son tiburones en realidad-, Pangasios y Peses mariposa de agua dulce.
Entries.1198: Angler's Guide Sum. Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Ver. Ed.3/Hablemos de ros. Algunos peces plagarn la mayora de las burbujas de agua dulce. Este es el caso de Tarariras y Pacs, ya que se pueden encontrar en varios lugares de pesca y solo se irn durante el invierno. Por cierto, es verano, y esta es la temporada para el Pez globo de agua dulce. Tambin podrs encontrar Terrores verde en los ros, ya que generalmente llegan en la primavera y se quedan durante el verano.
Entries.1199: Angler's Guide Fall Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Oto. Ed.3/Hablemos de anguilas y pulpos, solo se encuentran durante una temporada, pero los diferentes tipos prefieren diferentes condiciones climticas. Las anguilas son nocturnas y la mayora de los pulpos son diurnos, pero el Pulpo mmico prefiere el amanecer.
Entries.1200: Angler's Guide Win. Ed.3/50/-300/Basic/Gua del pescador Inv. Ed.3/Algunos peces prefieren lugares salvajes, hostiles y habitados, como Babolnes, Lampreas y Piraas. Algunos prefieren pantanos, como el Saltadores de lodo, pero ten cuidado en los pantanos porque podras encontrarte con una Serpiente de agua.^ Tambin recientemente hemos recibido informes no corroborados de algas y peces contaminados. En las creencias populares, la mancha se llama 'sombra'. Hasta que podamos confirmar cul es la sustancia, tenga cuidado con la vida acutica de aspecto sospechoso. Tambin le aconsejamos que lleve muestras a su instituto de ciencias local, siempre y cuando siga los protocolos de seguridad adecuados, para ayudarlos a comprender este extrao fenmeno.

Entries.1181: Thread-Sail Filefish/120/12/Fish -4/Stephanolepis cirrhifer/La aleta en su cabeza es en realidad un parsito.

Entries.angler8: Queridos pescadores,^^ Otro invierno y probablemente haya experimentado lo suficiente como para enfrentar nuestro gran desafo, los Tiburones duende se pueden encontrar en el ocano por las noches, son conocidos por ser feroces y extremadamente difciles de pescar, adems son feos.^ Las personas que lograron pescarlos y sobrevivieron dijeron que el dinero fue bastante bueno.^ Un subscriptor cientfico nos escribi para informarnos que a visto peces anormales en las alcantarillados, es posible que desees verificar eso.^ Les deseamos un feliz ao nuevo y volveremos en primavera.^^-Buena suerte en la pesca%item object 1196 1 %%
Entries.vincegift: Hey @,^Quera darle a Vincent una Estrella de mar para su cumpleaos. Le pregunt a Willy pero dijo que eres la mejor persona para ayudarme. Si me traes la estrella de mar te recompensar.^  -Gracias,^Kent%item quest 230 %%
Entries.angler9: Queridos pescadores,^^ Consejos avanzados de pesca en estanques: los Plecos y Comedores de algas se alimentan en el fondo del estanque durante las noches por lo general prefieren los das de lluvia, sin embargo algunos tipos prefieren aguas fras. El Pez elefante, Pez mariposa de agua dulce, Locha payaso y el Pangasio son peces comunes durante el clima clido. El clima fro atrae a los Sauger y Cachos a los estanques y durante el otoo se pueden encontrar Tiburnes de cola roja, Pangasio y Pez mariposa de agua dulce, tambin se encuentran durante el otoo.^^-Buena suerte en la pesca %item object 1197 1 %%
Entries.blinky: Se busca pescador^Necesito una buena muestra del pez mutante de tres ojos. Estoy realizando un experimento sobre los niveles de mutacin de los peces que viven en las alcantarillas.^Recompensa: 1000g^ -Demetrius%item quest 228 %%
Entries.robalo: Hey @^La temporada casi ha terminado y quera hacer un caldo de Lubina ya que estn deliciosos y se me estn acabando. Si me traes 20 de estos entonces te dar una recompensa muy generosa.^ -Gus%item quest 229 %%
Entries.angler10: Queridos pescadores,^^ Ros: algunos peces plegaran la mayora de los lugares de agua dulce, este es el caso de Tararira y Pac, se pueden encontrar en varios lugares de pesca y solo se irn durante el invierno, por cierto, es verano y esta es la temporada para el Pez globo de agua dulce, tambin aprovecha y captura el Terror Verde en los ros que generalmente llegan en la primavera y se quedan durante el verano.^^-Buena suerte en la pesca %item object 1198 1 %%
Entries.angler11: Queridos pescadores,^^ Vamos a hablar de anguilas y pulpos, solo se ven durante una temporada, pero los diferentes tipos prefieren diferentes condiciones climticas. Las Anguilas son nocturnas y la mayora de los Pulpos son diurnos, pero el Pulpo mmico se puede atrapar durante el amanecer en primavera.^^-Buena suerte en la pesca %item object 1199 1 %%
Entries.angler12: Queridos pescadores,^^ Algunos peces prefieren lugares salvajes e inhabitados, como Babolnes, Lampreas y Piraas, otros prefieren pantanos como el Saltador de lodo. Pero ten cuidado en los pantanos porque podras encontrarte con Serpientes de agua.^ Hemos recibido informes no corroborados de algas y peces contaminados. En las creencias populares, la mancha se llama sombro. Hasta que podamos confirmar cul es la sustancia, tenga cuidado al encontrar con la flora y fauna acuticas de aspecto sospechoso. Tambin le aconsejamos que enve muestras a su instituto de ciencias local, por supuesto, siguiendo los protocolos de seguridad.^^-Buena suerte en la pesca %item object 1200 1 %%
Entries.trapped: @,^Estoy investigando un hechizo osbcuro que mi ex esposa ha lanzado a un alma pobre.^CPodras traerme uno de los peces rojos que se pueden encontrar en su pantano? Creo que era un alma atrapada en un cuerpo de pez por algn encantamiento oscuro.^ -M. Rasmodius, Wizard %item quest 232 %%
